{{knowledge objective
|Identifiant=OIC-101-13-B
|Item_parent=Facial paralysis
|Item_parent_short=Facial paralysis
|Rank=B
|Intitle=Clinical iconography of a typical example of a parotid tumour complicated by PFP
|Description=Visualisation of parotid tumour invasion suggesting tumour-induced PFP
|Rubric=Multimedia content
|Contributors=
|Order=13}}
Please refer to the CEN website: www.cen-neurologie.fr where videos are available.

question.title: What is the typical presentation of a parotid tumour complicated by Parotid Fluid Pressure (PFP)?
question.description: Visualisation of parotid tumour invasion suggesting tumour-induced PFP

option_a.title: A large, firm mass in the parotid gland
option_a.description: A large, firm mass in the parotid gland, often with a well-defined border

option_b.title: A painless, slowly enlarging mass
option_b.description: A painless, slowly enlarging mass, often with a fluctuant texture

option_c.title: A fluctuant mass with a well-defined border
option_c.description: A fluctuant mass with a well-defined border, often with a soft texture

option_d.title: A firm, movable mass
option_d.description: A firm, movable mass, often with a well-defined border

correct_option.title: A large, firm mass in the parotid gland
correct_option.description: A large, firm mass in the parotid gland, often with a well-defined border
